Office Assistant (Computer Personnel) Job at Ledgerly




        
    

        
        Ledgerly is a fast-growing Tech company on a mission to become the financial "Operating System" for every ambitious Small and Medium Business (SMB) in Africa. We are building a platform that combines smart technology with real human expertise to make professional financial management and tax compliance radically accessible and stress-free.

We're not your typical company. We are an agile and ambitious team, obsessed with solving real problems for Nigerian entrepreneurs. We believe in working smart, moving fast, and building a company that makes a real impact. This is your chance to get in on the ground floor of a venture with massive potential.
     

            
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Office Assistant (Computer Personnel)

Job Location: Osogbo, Osun
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	Ledgerly Analytics Limited is seeking a detail-oriented and tech-savvy Office Assistant to join our team.
	This role is ideal for a candidate who combines administrative efficiency with advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel.


Key Requirements


	Minimum Qualification: SSCE / WASSCE (Candidates with OND, HND, or BSc are welcome to apply, provided they meet the technical requirements).
	Technical Mastery: Must be highly proficient in Microsoft Excel (ability to use formulas, pivot tables, and data formatting is essential).


Soft Skills:


	Attention to Detail: An eagle eye for spotting errors in data entry.
	Time Management: Ability to prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment.
	Communication: Clear verbal and written skills for internal reporting.


Salary
Attractive & Competitive.

Head of Finance (EPC) Job at TeamAce Limited




        
    

        
        TeamAce Limited - Our client, a leading Engineering, Procurement and Construction (EPC) Company, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head of Finance (EPC)

Job Location: Abule Egba, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	As the Head of Finance, you will be responsible for the strategic planning, implementation, management, and running of all financial activities of the company.
	This includes business planning, budgeting, forecasting, governance, risk management, and negotiations.
	You will also oversee investor relations and partnership compliance, while providing leadership and commercial insight to support the company’s long-term growth.


Responsibilities


	Provide leadership, direction, and management of the finance and accounting team
	Develop strategic recommendations to the CEO/Executive Management Team
	Manage financial forecasting, budgeting, and oversee preparation of all financial reporting
	Advise on long-term financial and business planning initiatives
	Provide commercial insight and leadership to exceed business plan targets
	Ensure risk and compliance management frameworks are embedded and operational
	Establish and maintain strong relationships with senior management, investors, and external stakeholders
	Review and oversee all finance, HR, and IT-related formal procedures.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or related discipline
	Minimum of 10 years of progressive finance experience, with proven leadership and management exposure
	Chartered Accountant (ICAN, CPA) required; MBA is highly desirable
	Strong entrepreneurial, strategic planning, and financial management skills
	Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with executive presence
	Ability to work effectively with senior management, investors, and external stakeholders.


Salary
N900,0000 - N1,000,000 monthly.

  "description": "Hotel Capitol is a modern and contemporary hotel that offers not only luxury but comfort at its best. The three-star hotel is strategically located at the heart of Omole Phase 1, making it easily accessible with excellent road networks to other parts of the mainland and the city of Lagos as a whole. The 32-room Hotel offers tastefully furnished deluxe executive and super executive rooms as well as one- and two-bedroom luxury suites.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Hotel Receptionist
Job Location:&nbsp;Berger,&nbsp;Lagos

Job Location: Illupeju, Lagos

Description
     

            
    




	Fronthill Controls is seeking a proactive and results-driven Marketing Executive to support our marketing and business development efforts in the controls and automation sector.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for creating and executing marketing strategies, enhancing brand visibility, generating leads, and supporting sales through targeted campaigns and content.
	This role requires strong communication skills, creativity, and a solid understanding of B2B marketing within the engineering and construction industry.


Key Responsibilities
Marketing Strategy & Planning:


	Support the development and execution of marketing strategies aligned with company objectives.
	Assist in planning marketing campaigns, events, and promotions for products and services.
	Conduct market research to identify industry trends, competitors, and opportunities.


Content Creation & Brand Management:


	Create high-quality marketing content including brochures, case studies, presentations, and social media posts.
	Maintain and update company website, ensuring accurate product/service information.
	Manage brand consistency across all marketing materials and platforms.
	Develop and manage content for digital platforms, including LinkedIn and industry forums.


Lead Generation & Campaign Management:


	Plan and execute lead generation campaigns (email, social media, digital ads, etc.).
	Track and analyze campaign performance using relevant metrics.
	Support sales team with marketing collateral, proposals, and product information.


Event & Exhibition Support:


	Support planning and coordination of industry events, trade shows, and conferences.
	Assist in booth design, marketing materials, and logistics.
	Manage follow-up activities post-events to convert leads into opportunities.


Customer & Market Engagement:


	Maintain customer databases and update CRM with leads and activities.
	Engage with customers and industry partners to build brand awareness.
	Coordinate customer communications, newsletters, and company announcements.


Reporting & Analytics:


	Prepare regular marketing performance reports and insights.
	Monitor key metrics such as lead conversion, website traffic, social engagement, and ROI.
	Provide recommendations to improve marketing effectiveness.


Requirements & Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Business Administration, Communications, or related fields
	Minimum 2 - 4 years of experience in marketing, preferably in B2B, engineering, or construction sectors.
	Strong written and verbal communication skills.
	Proficient in digital marketing tools and platforms (social media, email marketing, CMS, analytics).
	Basic knowledge of graphic design tools (Canva, Corel-draw, Adobe Photoshop/Illustrator) is a plus.
	Experience with CRM systems is preferred.
	Creative mindset with strong attention to detail.
	Ability to work independently and collaboratively within a team.
	Strong organizational skills and ability to manage multiple tasks.


Core Competencies:


	Marketing Strategy & Execution
	Content Creation & Brand Management
	Digital Marketing & Lead Generation
	Market Research & Competitive Analysis
	Communication & Presentation Skills
	Project Management & Coordination.
